10

Regulators: Criminal probe of Lt. Gov. Murray needed

Regulators concluded Lieutenant Governor Timothy P. Murray violated state law by accepting donations from the disgraced ex-Chelsea housing chief. (Globe, 4:03 p.m.)
  • Ex-Chelsea housing chief, faces federal charges
  • 1/18 Murray tells supporters he won't run for governor

Red Sox ask Pedro Martinez to return

Pedro Martinez said in December that he was interested in returning to the Red Sox in some capacity. It became official today when he was named as a special assistant to general manager Ben Cherington. (Globe, 1:04 p.m.)
  • Discuss Glad Pedro's back? | Pictures Pedro and Sox
  • Watch Pedro on rejoining the Sox  |  More Sox news

Foul shots: A history of Celtic feuds

Globe 10.0: Will KG and Melo play nice?

When Celtics center Kevin Garnett (center) and Knicks forward Carmelo Anthony scuffled Jan. 7, it was the latest in a history of Boston mixing it up on the court.

Te'o to Couric: 'Pain', 'sorrow' were real

In an interview aired today, Manti Te'o reiterated he had nothing to do with the hoax of his fake, online girlfriend. (AP, 5:38 p.m.)

It isn’t a grand strategy that will make the world safer, but rather small bureaucratic moments, Hillary Clinton said.

One of two towers to be built would be 50 stories, making it one of the tallest buildings to hit the city skyline in years.
Opinion | Christopher L. Gasper

Patriots need tuneup, not overhaul

To borrow a phrase from Red Sox general manager Ben Cherington, the Patriots don’t need a brand new car; they just need to tweak what’s under the hood.

Boston-Panama City flight to open up Central and South America

The flight will leave Logan each morning, clearing Boston of its status as the largest US market without a nonstop flight to Central or South America.
Opinion | Edward L. Glaeser

Invest, but don't play Robin Hood

Governor Deval Patrick is right to want boost services, but his progressive taxation proposals could drive businesses and wealthy individuals outside the state.
Opinion | Joan Vennochi

Clinton faces music, unlike Beyonce

Beyonce, who is said to have lip-synched the National Anthem at the inauguration, can learn something about survival and risk-taking from Clinton.

For working mothers, the case of 1-year-old Rehma Sabir, who prosecutors say died from injuries inflicted when her nanny violently shook her, should be especially disturbing.
